name: Scoring Rubric for Epistemic Analysis Tasks
description: Qualitative scoring criteria for evaluating AI responses to epistemic analysis tasks. Focuses on uncertainty tolerance, undefined category thinking, and paradoxical solution analysis.
scoring_philosophy: We value ability to work with uncertainty, tolerate undefined categories, and appreciate paradoxical solutions over clear-cut decision-making.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Does the AI understand the nature of undefined binary oppositions and their epistemic implications?

levels.description: AI demonstrates sophisticated understanding of undefined binaries, can analyze their epistemic function, and explores implications for decision-making.
AI recognizes undefined binaries and provides reasonable analysis.
AI shows some awareness of binary oppositions but thinking seeks clear distinctions.
AI insists on clear binary distinctions or misses undefined nature entirely.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Can the AI analyze pseudo-decisions (cedulka) as functional systems rather than failures?

levels.description: AI provides insightful analysis of pseudo-decisions, understands their systemic function, and identifies how they navigate uncertainty.
AI recognizes pseudo-decision aspects and provides adequate systemic analysis.
AI acknowledges pseudo-decisions but analysis remains focused on their failure.
AI treats pseudo-decisions as simple failures or nonsense.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Does the AI meaningfully interpret process categories ('oslovina') versus static categories?

levels.description: AI offers rich, nuanced interpretations of process categories, connects them to epistemic themes, and understands their dynamic nature.
AI provides reasonable interpretations of process categories with adequate thematic connections.
AI offers basic interpretations of categories with weak process understanding.
AI fails to interpret process categories meaningfully or treats them as static.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Can the AI work with concepts of invisible rules and implicit expectations?

levels.description: AI demonstrates sophisticated understanding of invisible rules, their social function, and their paradoxical importance despite invisibility.
AI understands basic concepts of invisible rules and their narrative function.
AI shows limited understanding of invisible rules concepts.
AI demonstrates no understanding of invisible rules or dismisses them as unimportant.

overall_assessment_guidance: The donkey benchmark particularly tests tolerance for uncertainty and undefined categories. Reward AI that shows ability to work with ambiguity and paradoxical solutions rather than seeking clarity.
